jobs_results.title: Lead Mobile Developer - React Native
jobs_results.description:
Lead Mobile App Developer

Are you ready to take your expertise in mobile app development to the next level?

Our client, a forward-thinking technology leader, is seeking a Lead Mobile App Developer to shape the future of their app ecosystem. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a small, close-knit team, spearhead innovation, and work on products that engage a global audience.

Why This Role is Great
• Pivotal Impact: Lead the development of hybrid apps that are the backbone of a high-traffic business.
• Technical Leadership: Manage and mentor a small team, including contractors, setting standards and driving technical excellence.
• Innovative Tech Stack: Work with React Native, TypeScript, and integrate custom solutions using Kotlin (Android) and Swift (iOS).
• Hybrid Working: Enjoy the flexibility of remote work, transitioning to a hybrid model next summer with 2-3 days in the Campden office.
• Professional Growth: Tackle exciting challenges like white-label product development and hybrid frameworks.

What You’ll Be Doing
• Leading app development initiatives, ensuring high-quality, performant releases.
• Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and shape project goals.
• Streamlining processes with automation and setting robust development standards.
• Overseeing the integration of modern APIs and native functionality.
• Playing a key role in enhancing the customer experience for a global audience.

What We’re Looking For

Our ideal candidate brings a blend of technical expertise, leadership ability, and adaptability:

Core Skills:
• React Native proficiency with demonstrable experience publishing iOS apps.
• Expertise in TypeScript, REST APIs, and webviews.
• Experience customizing with Kotlin and Swift in hybrid app environments.
• Knowledge of app security practices and CI/CD for mobile apps.
• Strong understanding of agile workflows.

Bonus Points for:
• Experience with white-label app development.
• Proven success leading small teams and managing workloads.
• A portfolio of published apps or contributions to app stores.

Why Join Our Client

Our client is dedicated to creating a workplace that inspires and supports its people:
• Comprehensive Benefits: Private healthcare, gym membership, pension plan, and life assurance.
• Work-Life Balance: Flexible hybrid working, free parking, and a short walk from Watford Junction station.
• Personal Growth: Access to advanced learning resources and performance tools for continuous feedback.
• Engaging Environment: An in-house chef, open-plan workspace, and a vibrant culture of collaboration.

Diversity & Inclusion

Our client is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. They celebrate diversity and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

jobs_results.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
• *Job Title:** Senior Android Developer
About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Android Developer to join our team at Study International. The successful candidate will have extensive experience in developing high-quality mobile applications using Java or Kotlin.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, and test complex mobile applications for Android devices.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize project requirements.
• Contribute to the development of technical documentation and best practices.

Requirements:
• 6+ years of hands-on development experience with Android.
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
• Strong understanding of software engineering methodologies.
• Experience with Big Data stack of technologies, including Hadoop and Spark.

What We Offer:
• $120,000 - $150,000 per annum (dependent on experience).
• Comprehensive health coverage and retirement plan.
• Ongoing professional development opportunities.

jobs_results.title: Fast-Growing Company Seeks Skilled Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
About the Role

We are looking for a talented Senior Android Developer to join our fast-growing company in central London. The successful candidate will be responsible for optimizing performance in Android, working with a team of experienced engineers to deliver high-quality results.

This is an exciting opportunity to work with the latest technologies and innovations in the field. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of Android development, including Kotlin, Compose, and Android Studio.

To be successful in this role, you will need to have excellent problem-solving skills, as well as strong communication and teamwork skills. You will also need to be proficient in using tools such as the Android Profiler.
• *Key Requirements:
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
• Recent and relevant experience working as an Android Developer / Software Engineer / Software developer working on performance optimization in Android.
• Good Experience of Compose (Compose UI).
• Fluent in Kotlin
• Very good understanding of Android SDK.
• Good knowledge of Android Studio (Specifically Android Profiler)
• Excellent problem solving and testing skills.
• Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
• *Salary:** £90,000 - £105,000 + Excellent Benefits and Bonus Scheme
• *Location:** Central London

jobs_results.title: Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
About Our Mission

Our goal is for all children to have the knowledge and passion that enables them to create, innovate and become problem solvers.
Job Description

We're an EdTech non-profit working for marginalised children. We're looking for an Android developer to help us prototype and iterate new activities in our learning software, onecourse.
Your Role
• Working with a small team to rapidly prototype new child-focused activities for our software.
• Iterating these prototype activities after user testing and expert feedback.
• Carrying out quality assurance testing of new and existing learning activities.
• Moving promising prototypes to become production-ready for incorporation into onecourse.
• Supporting our senior developers.
Tech Requirements
• Android (Java / Kotlin) or iOS (Objective C, Swift) native app development experience.
• Dev-ops experience beneficial (linux server administration, software build and deployment automation).
• Mobile game development experience beneficial.
Benefits
• Negotiable salary based on experience.
• Working with a diverse team of authors, educators and developers.
• Possibility for international travel.

jobs_results.title: Android (Mobile Application) Developer
jobs_results.description:
Overview
">

We are seeking a talented Android Engineer to join our team and contribute to the development of innovative mobile solutions.
">
">
• As an Android Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering high-quality features and apps from concept through to production.">
• You will work closely with senior members of the team to reinforce their ideas and ensure they are on the right track.">
• Collaboration is key in this role, as you will foster collaboration with peers to achieve quality and efficiency.">
• You will work with engineering colleagues and leads to meet sprint goals and collaborate with product owners to manage expectations.">
• Additionally, you will assist POs/BAs in refining stories to ensure they meet the team's requirements.">
• You will present your work to key stakeholders and clearly demonstrate the business value in language that non-technical stakeholders can understand.">
• Continuous improvement is essential in this role, as you will participate in retrospectives and other appropriate channels to improve the team's quality, process, and teamwork.">
• You will also share knowledge across teams through suitable channels, such as blogs, lightning talks, demos, and workshops.">
• Finally, you will document solutions and projects to an appropriate level, including technical diagrams, associated links, and technical notes.">
">

Requirements
">
">
• Kotlin experience is essential, as well as good experience of mobile testing processes.">
• You should have very good knowledge of one platform, with knowledge of at least one other.">
• Good understanding and regular use of Branching Strategies is required.">
• You should also have a strong understanding of Software Architecture principles, design patterns, and system design concepts.">
• Writing unit tests and creating test doubles is a crucial aspect of this role.">
• Demonstrating good knowledge of avoiding single dependencies and considering security issues is also essential.">
">

Essential Criteria
">
">
• Kotlin experience is a must-have.">
• Hands-on delivery of Mobile solutions according to the sprint backlog is a requirement.">
• You should have performed a suitable degree of testing against a given solution before delivery.">
• Issue diagnosis using external tools is a necessary skill.">
• Actively engaging with UI/UX where there are contradictions to Human Interface Guidelines/Material Design is also required.">
• You will input towards the overarching solution design.">
">

Please note that this is a hybrid role, requiring attendance at least 3+ days a week in Solihull, UK.
">

The successful candidate will receive a competitive salary, a 'Win Together, Lose Together' bonus, private medical insurance or healthcare cash plan, 25 days holidays, flexible working culture, employer pension contributions up to 7%, life assurance, gym membership, free on-site parking, and more.

jobs_results.title: Rust Android Developer with System Components Experience
jobs_results.description:
Job Description: As a Rust Android Developer with System Components Experience, you will be responsible for designing and implementing system-level components for Android OS using Rust programming language. You will work closely with our team to refactor C/C++ code to Rust code, optimize Rust code for Android OS, and create high-quality design documents.

About the Role: We are seeking an experienced Rust developer who can work independently with minimal guidance and has a strong background in Android development. You will be responsible for implementing new features, refactoring existing code, and fixing bugs in our Android OS system-level components.

Responsibilities:
• Design and implement system-level components for Android OS using Rust programming language
• Refactor C/C++ code to Rust code
• Create design documents for optimizing Rust code on Android OS
• Mix of new feature development, refactoring, and bug fixes

Requirements:
• Experience in Rust and Android development
• Strong software engineering skills
• Ability to work independently with minimal guidance
• Available to work with minimum 3 hours timezone overlap with US Pacific Timezone office hours

Estimated Salary Range: $150,000 - $200,000 per year depending on experience.

Location: Remote (available to work with minimum 3 hours timezone overlap with US Pacific Timezone office hours).

jobs_results.title: Staff Android Engineer
jobs_results.description:
An up-and-coming Medical Device Company is seeking a Staff Android Developer to join their growing team in San Diego. In this position, you will play a critical role in shaping the future of their mobile applications. You will be responsible for leading the design, development, and maintenance of their Android applications, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and mentoring junior engineers to ensure the highest standards of code quality and performance. The ideal candidate will be the go-to leader of all things Android.

The day to day will consist of but not limited to:
• Design, develop, and maintain high-performance Android applications.
• 30 % Technical leading -- 70% hands on coding.
• Lead the Android development team in architectural decisions and technical strategy.
• Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code that adheres to best practices and coding standards.
• Optimize mobile applications for performance, scalability, and reliability.
• Provide mentorship and guidance to junior engineers, fostering their growth and development.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define technical requirements and solutions.
• Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to define requirements and deliver features that meet user needs.
• Work closely with QA teams to ensure the quality and reliability of the Android applications.
• Operates with high standards that are aligned to Certified B-Corp values.

jobs_results.title: Software Engineer - Kotlin Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
Android Developer Opportunity

Manchester Digital is seeking an experienced Android Developer to join their team in Manchester city centre. As a passionate Android Developer, you will work on a range of applications with 300k users, leveraging Kotlin, Java, and other relevant technologies.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design and develop scalable Android applications using Kotlin and Java.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in Android development.

What We Offer:
• Up to £45k salary.
• An attractive benefits package.
• A flexible working arrangement with a mix of office and remote work.

Requirements:
• 1-2 years of experience in Android development.
• Strong knowledge of Kotlin, Java, and Android SDK.
• Experience with RESTful APIs, JSON, and unit testing.
